studying pathological information systems and how narratives spread @ Stanford Internet Observatory. Hi, i'm Tricia. She/Her. I like to say I'm a marketer who identifies as infosec. Work life: I'm a technical writer in security research. I work with security research all day, every day. Any and everything from malware analysis to IPv6 and in between. Can confirm it is in fact, always DNS. I work with security researchers to help tell their story in an effective way without degrading their technical acumen. It's a lot harder than it sounds, trust me.  Real life: I have a theatre degree and am pretty much always singing. I have a Pomsky named Darth who i love to take pictures and videos of and put online. I am obsessed with true crime and jigsaw puzzles and occasionally do standup comedy. Cross between real and work life: I occasionally write, record, and produce infosec parody songs. Be kind, love yourself, and keep kicking ass.

I'm a #hacker. Question my use of that term? Well I have been in the truest sense of that term since I was a young kid. I'm also a #CISO, 25+ years in tech have been good to me overall. I serve on multiple boards as well, back to that whole "tech has treated me well thing". I'm fortunate to be an Internationally recognized Public #Speaker and the Author of "Cyber Security Career Guide". I do my level best to give back to this community.

I'm also a #pilot and love #aviation. I live in the northern Midwest of the US so if I want good #BBQ I gotta make it myself, and that's just what I do.

If you're reading an opinion I posted I assure you it's mine and does not reflect the views of my employer or any organizations I'm affiliated with.

My pronouns are she/her, and if my listing that bothers you, GTFOH right now.

Come for the #infosec, stay for #HackerFlightSchool, and eat all the #HackerBBQ
